meanings.definition: a sudden event, such as an accident or natural catastrophe, that causes great damage or loss
meanings.sent1: The earthquake was a disaster for the town, destroying many buildings.
meanings.sent2: The hurricane was a natural disaster that left a path of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a disaster when it started raining heavily.
meanings.sent4: Her failed attempt at baking a cake was a disaster of epic proportions.
meanings.sent5: The tsunami was a disaster of unimaginable scale, wiping out entire villages.

meanings.sent1: The party was a disaster with no one showing up.
meanings.sent2: The project turned into a disaster when all the files got deleted.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at juggling ended in disaster as the balls went flying everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The play was a disaster with actors forgetting their lines and props falling apart.
meanings.sent5: The camping trip was a disaster with tents collapsing and food getting spoiled.
